title: League of Legends on MacOS Sierra?
body: Now that OS Sierra is out, is there any compatibility issues with it and league of legends? I've heard of issues with El Capitan so I've never upgraded to El capitan, still running yosemite, but I really dig the built in siri part so wanted to know if it's fine to upgrade to Sierra. Would help if a rioter/someone on the mac team could give their insights on this.

replies.body: Same FPS problems as everyone else. :(

Crapppp.  Why didn't I look at this 
before I downloaded OS X sierra.  My league won't even boot up.
i have the same issue since i installed sierra yesterday.

I changed my laptop to a newer version and have now also Sierra and each time I want to open it it says that there is an unspecified error and that I need to check the logs. I've contacted riot for help but it still says the same thing even after exchanging multiple emails with the support team.
When I launched League of legends it crashed the whole computer :O Help!

The full release has been out for a day, so we haven't had much feedback on how it runs for a lot of players. We've seen a number of issues reported by players running the beta, but we aren't aware if those were resolved in the full release. You can try it out and let me know how it goes, but you may need to roll back to El Capitan if you encounter big problems.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Do we have ANY updates on the bug(s) situation? The FPS problem makes it IMPOSSIBLE to play. Could you get back to us with any info please
Can you please ask riot experts to fix this? I cant play the game for like 1 month :"(

Can you tell developers to fix multitasking issue first? its even more annoying than the fps problem.

When you press Command+Tab (for multitasking) or when game ends and you return to your desktop, screen is full of graphical glitches and lags, I can record a video to see the exact issue if you want.

After tabbing out and in again, everything is fine again for another 1 or 2 minutes before everything stops working again. I tested this with several keyboards and mice. Any suggestions? Same Problem Here guys :/ Updates yesterday to Sierra and played a game then. My mouse didnt work (it went in Not by me moved directions) and also my fps(There were Shown that i still have 120) dropped hard and I bugged around. I cant play like this :/ (wanted to climb to dia this week :o).

At my game menue, the point "Software mouse" was activated. After deactivating i had no more Problems with it :)

I am currently running OS Sierra, and LoL originally open and ran fine for about a month or so.  Suddenly today, Nov. 16th, the client refuses to open and the launch screen wont even appear. I've deleted the LoL application from my mac, redownloaded the app into my applications folder from the LoL website, and still the same problem persists. It says the file size is only 5.6 MB, which I think is too small comparing it to other apps such as Curse. Is this due to a new client update in process with the new Beta released?

AMD Radeon R9 M395X 4096 MB 
16GB RAM

Its impossible to play. I've tried everything: Closing applications, changing in-game settings, repairing corrupt game files, SMC Reset, AND NVRAM Reset. Nothing is working....

I just played some rounds of League of Legends 6.19.16_09_15_21_03.

There were a few things that I did do prior to playing rounds of League of Legends. These were things that I had to do in the previous version of Apple's operating system for its computers, when I was running OS X El Capitan version 10.11.6 (15G1004).

I have no issues playing in Summoner's Rift now. This is what I did to eliminate the issues.

This is what I am running at this moment in time. I was only running the League of Legends  version 6.19.16_09_15_21_03 game, Text Edit Version 1.12 (329), Curse version 7.0.6116.18425 Alpha, and Safari Version 10.0 (12602.1.50.0.10), and initially in Safari I only had one tab open to this League of Legends boards page.

macOS Sierra version 10.12 (16A323)
MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2015)
processor 2.5 GHz Intel Core i7
memory 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3
graphics Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB

  Model Name:	MacBook Pro
  Model Identifier:	MacBookPro11,4
  Processor Name:	Intel Core i7
  Processor Speed:	2.5 GHz
  Number of Processors:	1
  Total Number of Cores:	4
  L2 Cache (per Core):	256 KB
  L3 Cache:	6 MB
  Memory:	16 GB

I had a wired Logitech mouse, a pair of Apple earbuds, the power adapter, and a Thunderbolt to Ethernet adapter with an Ethernet cable plugged into the machine. I wanted to keep the least amount plugged into the machine as possible.

This machine was on OS X El Capitan version 10.11.6 (15G1004). I had installed all updates on the machine prior to installing macOS Sierra version 10.12.

As a just in case I launched the League of Legends. Before I clicked on the large “Launch” button in the top middle of the screen, I clicked on the gear icon in the upper right-hand corner of the page. I then deselected the “Allow Peer to Peer Transfer” check box. I then clicked on the question mark icon that was to the left of the gear icon and clicked on the “Repair” button and then I walked away. That process checks installed files for errors and if it finds any, it fixes them. That process can be hours long. In my case, since this was a fresh installation, it found no errors and only took about 45 minutes to complete.

I opened up my “System Preferences,” went to the “Network” preference and then set a static IP address for my Thunderbolt Ethernet connection, since I use a wired Ethernet connection on this computer.  You should never game on a wireless connection, but some people still do.

These are just home use settings that are common to most people. I used 192.168.1.31 because I know that that number is unused on my network. Your number scheme may be a bit different from mine, but you MUST use a unique IP address on your network. Do NOT pick an IP address that is in your router's DHCP range of addresses. You don't want a collision on your network. Most home routers start at 192.168.1.100 and dole out numbers through 192.168.1.150 by default.

￼IP Address: 192.168.1.31
Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
Router: 192.168.1.1
DNS Server: 8.8.8.8, 8.8.4.4

I went into the Advanced settings and set my DNS to 8.8.8.8, 8.8.4.4  These are Google's DNS servers.

I also turned off my IPv6 configuration. “Off” is NOT an option initially. Initially you will have 3 options in the drop down menu. 

Automatically
Manually
Link-local Only

You need to enable “Off” by opening up your Terminal application.

Open up the Applications folder. Then in the Applications you need to open up the Utilities folder. In the Utilities folder you will find the Terminal application.

Open up Terminal and type or copy paste this in to disable the IPv6.

On a Thunderbolt Ethernet connection you would type in or copy paste in the following into the Terminal window then press your enter key.

networksetup -setv6off Thunderbolt\ Ethernet

In order to turn IPv6 off on the Wi-Fi connection you would type in or copy paste in the following into the Terminal window then press your enter key.

networksetup -setv6off Wi-Fi

If you have a computer that has an Ethernet port and you do not need to use a Thunderbolt to Ethernet adapter as I have to you would type in or copy paste in the following into the Terminal window then press your enter key.

networksetup -setv6off Ethernet

To reenable IPv6 you would type in or copy paste in the following into the Terminal window then press your enter key.

networksetup -setv6automatic Wi-Fi

networksetup -setv6automatic Ethernet

networksetup -setv6automatic  Thunderbolt\ Ethernet

I then quit League of Legends, quit Terminal, and restarted my computer.

I then started up League of Legends and played a few rounds without any issues.

I do have to warn you though. Turning off IPv6 on a Macintosh computer is a double edged sword. I did create a secondary location with a static IP address separate from my normal location setting. On your computer you probably have a default location named "Automatic." 

This next tidbit comes from http://osxdaily.com/2014/04/18/disable-ipv6-mac-os-x/

_"Though most users don’t use IPv6 directly, disabling IPv6 is not without consequences, and thus should only be done by users who know what they’re doing and why they’re doing it. Some of the core OS X system services, like the discovery service Bonjour, use IPv6. Accordingly, disabling IPv6 may render AirDrop sharing unusable, certain print services will become unavailable, and some other convenient Mac features may turn inoperable as well. This makes it impractical to disable for many."_

There is one peculiar thing that I have noticed, but I noticed this in OS X El Capitan version 10.11.6 (15G1004), and I’m still seeing it in macOS Sierra version 10.12. When I launch the Activity Monitor /Applications/Utilities/Activity Monitor I have noticed that the I see UserKernel (Not Responding) in red, so I click on it, and I force quit it. The game seems to be no worse for wear by terminating this stuck process. The game works just fine both when I force quit the UserKernel (Not Responding) in red or if I just leave it alone. It’s just something peculiar that I’ve seen.

I have a sneaking suspicion that some of you that are having issues just plane don't have enough ram installed in your computers, and bumping up your ram may help you out tremendously. Launch your "Activity Monitor" /Applications/Utilities/Activity Monitor and check and see how much ram you are using and how much physical memory you have and how much memory is used. I have 16 GB of ram installed, and currently I am using 9.25 GB of ram. Most of your machines can handle 16 GB of ram even if Apple officially says that you can only run 8 GB of ram.

Download and install Mactracker. http://mactracker.ca It's a free database of everything that Apple has ever manufactured. It will tell you what type of ram and how much ram you can actually install in your machine. Make sure that the ram chips that you buy are made for Apple computers. Ram chips that are manufactured specifically for Apple computers have to meet a much higher standard than those meant for any old pos low quality manufactured machine. There are many good manufacturers of ram chips out there and many of them have memory scanners that are made just for you so you get the exact chips that you need. Ram chips are not hard to install on an Apple computer. Apple makes it really easy for you to install them yourself, and even though the chips for an Apple computer must meet a much higher manufacturing standard for Apple computers, most chip sets are pretty inexpensive in comparison to those sold for other manufacturers machines.

Oh, and dial back your in game graphics. You don't need to run your game on the highest graphics settings.

I almost forgot, I shut my computer down each night, and I restart my computer when I want to use it to game. Many people NEVER shut down their computers and wind up having some weird oddities that a simple restart will cure.

Well, I hope this helps someone.

Few seconds later ill get a attempting to reconnect signe and then im back in the game for a few minutes till i cant control my champ again. I also have been disconecting from PvP.Net all the time. Take in consideration my internet is perfectly stable at about 10 mb/s. 
Is this a problem on the part of League or the OS ?

Hi guys so i have an update on the issue,  I managed to solve my problem by doing this.
1. get rid of the current version of lg 
2. redownload it 
3. when it has loaded you will see a window with the icon League and a folder bellow it saying " Applications"
4. take the league icon and drag it bellow to the Application folder and drop it in there. 
5. Click the Application icon and find the league folder you just dropped and  click on it 
Ta da ! it should be working , im  using a mac book pro with the newest OS Sierra update and this solution has worked for me.
Good luck !!!

Hi, I have a new iMac with Sierra installed. When I try to download League of Legends for it, it does download the .dmg file. Yet when I click the installer to start installing, nothing happens.. Can anyone help me out here? Have no clue what to do to get the game running.
(I know apple is not ideal for gaming, yet I needed an apple for work. Posted this on /r MacGaming aswell, yet thusfar no response, so figured might try posting it here.)
TIA

> [{quoted}](name=Naala,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=evOyzTFN,comment-id=001e,timestamp=2016-10-07T20:51:56.745+0000)
>
> Hi, I have a new iMac with Sierra installed. When I try to download League of Legends for it, it does download the .dmg file. Yet when I click the installer to start installing, nothing happens.. Can anyone help me out here? Have no clue what to do to get the game running.
> (I know apple is not ideal for gaming, yet I needed an apple for work. Posted this on /r MacGaming aswell, yet thusfar no response, so figured might try posting it here.)
> TIA

Double click the 4.1 MB "League of Legends NA.dmg" that you downloaded and the "League of Legends NA" volume will mount for you.
A new window will open and you will see 2 things, the "League of Legends" application and an "Applications" folder alias.
Drag the "League of Legends" application into the "Applications" folder alias.
The "League of Legends" application will copy itself into the "Applications" folder.
Eject the "League of Legends NA" volume that mounted when you originally double clicked the "League of Legends NA.dmg" 
Open up the actual "Applications" folder on your computer.
The pathway is Macintosh HD > Applications > League of Legends.

If you can not see the Macintosh HD because it is hidden by default, click on the Finder icon in your dock (the blue smiley guy is Finder), then move your cursor up to the menu bar and click on "Go" then go down to "Computer" and click on "Computer."

Double click on the "League of Legends" application and the game will launch and then it will begin to download all of the files that are missing. 
Walk away from your computer. The download of the actual files may take hours depending on your Internet connection. That "League of Legends" application will grow. On my computer it has grown to 6.46 GB and as Riot releases more updates, it will continue to grow.
You may want to read my earlier post above. Yes, it's long, but it solved my issues, and that's why I shared it with others. My hope was to elevate the stress of others.

Oh, I almost forgot, I shut my computer down each night, and I restart my computer when I want to use it to game. Many people NEVER shut down their computers and wind up having some weird oddities that a simple restart will cure.
